messages.subject: thought's on tsuba history
messages.msgSnippet: all, thinking about an Akasaka guard in my collection, I was re reading some thoughts on the style of work that concerned Akasaka and also Tosa Myochin. Guards
messages.messageBody:
all, thinking about an Akasaka guard in my collection, I was re reading
some thoughts on the style of work that concerned Akasaka and also Tosa
Myochin. Guards that are made with traditional sword forging and display
hada clearly in the Ha, generally Mokume, are thought to have a larger
hada in the older guards and finer hada in the later Edo examples.

Has anyone ever heard this before or can confirm this ?.

Cheers

Rich Turner
